stem: A patient with granulomatosis with polyangiitis reports numbness over the dorsolateral hand near the thumb without motor deficits. Which nerve branch is most likely affected?

choices.D: Recurrent branch of the median nerve
choices.E: Dorsal cutaneous branch of the ulnar nerve

rationale_correct: The superficial radial nerve is purely sensory and supplies the dorsolateral hand near the thumb.

rationale_distractors.B: PIN is a motor branch; sensory loss would not be isolated with PIN.
rationale_distractors.C: Lateral antebrachial cutaneous supplies lateral forearm, not dorsolateral hand.
rationale_distractors.D: Recurrent median is motor to thenar muscles; no cutaneous innervation.
rationale_distractors.E: Ulnar dorsal cutaneous supplies medial dorsum of the hand.

evidence.citation: Anderson A. CIL â€“ Multisystem autoimmune diseases. Dec 11, 2024.
